intro: Elatostema cyrtophyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant features small, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically arranged in clusters. Elatostema cyrtophyllum is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
